subject: Home & DIY
title: Windows: The Weakest Link
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Windows: The Weakest Link.

hook.text: A standard wall has an R-value of 13-21. A single-pane window? About R-1. It's like a hole in your insulation.

buildup.text: Glass conducts heat about 15 times faster than fiberglass insulation. Windows are the thermal weak point of every home.

discovery.text: Double-pane windows trap an air gap between panes, roughly doubling insulation to R-2. Triple-pane reaches R-5 or more.

twist.text: Filling the gap with argon gas instead of air boosts performance further because argon conducts heat 34% less.

climax.text: Low-E coatings reflect infrared heat back inside while letting visible light throughâ€”invisible technology on the glass.

punchline.text: Your window is a wall pretending to be glass.

quiz.question: Why is argon gas used between double-pane window glass?
options: Argon conducts heat less than regular air
